subject: Management
title: Trust as Foundation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Trust as Foundation usable.

hook.text: Navy SEALs choose trust over talent. They'd rather have a B player they can rely on than an A player they can't.

buildup.text: Patrick Lencioni's pyramid: trust is the base. Without it, nothing else works.

discovery.text: Trust means: I believe you'll do what you say, you have my back, and you'll tell me hard truths.

twist.text: Trust isn't built by team-building events. It's built by small, repeated acts of reliability.

climax.text: Be reliable. Follow through. Admit mistakes. Trust compounds one kept promise at a time.

punchline.text: Trust isn't a feeling. It's a pattern of kept promises.

quiz.question: How is trust built in high-performing teams?
options: Through small repeated acts of reliability and follow-through
Through one-time team-building events and offsites
Trust forms automatically after working together long enough
